Reviews.Title: Be the life of the party.
Reviews.Author: Anakasha
Reviews.Content: Anyone who loved using Polaroid or Instant cameras in the past, this little (sort of) gem is going to make you do the Charlie Brown happy dance.I took this baby out the first night that I got it and while it is a bit bulkier than my tiny point and shoot, it is way more fun.  My friends and I were backstage at a show and we were able to take photos with the band and have them autograph the photos for us.  Not to mention when was the last time you got a group of people standing around laughing at pictures you just took.As much as I love my new friend maker, there are a number of pros and cons.Pros:The amount of visual effects that can be added to the pictures is staggering considering that this camera is doing a lot to begin with.There are 10 different borders from snowflakes, and hearts to standard Polaroid, and for the vintage peel apart enthusiast there is a border just for you.A multitude of shooting programs from the standard come with every camera (daylight, night, portrait, landscape) to a plethora of fun ones like LOMO, snow (for shooting against snowy background), party, soft skin, flowing water, fisheye, and my personal favorite pre-composition where you can take a picture as a reference first and then shoot the subject in front of the precaptured image.In addition there are also color options like vintage polaroid, b&w;, sepia, and b&w; w/ vignetting.Since it has a memory chip you can give away the printed pictures because have them saved.The Zink paper doesn't tear.Cons:People are so fascinated by it that you will be required to play show and tell. This gets worse once you print because everyone will want a copy for themselves, and even though the Zink paper is cheaper than the Polaroid film was, at approx. $.60 per print this could get expensive fast.The battery will only print about 25 shots before dying.  I also haven't found a place to purchase an additional battery pack.The only way to check the battery is to turn the camera on.  I wish they had put an indicator light on the outside so you can see when it's safe to unplug. I personally prefer to charge my batteries outside of the camera.The camera will only hold 10 sheets of paper at a time.  Which means you are dragging packs of paper with you.The printing process is relatively slow, not quite as slow as waiting for a Polaroid to develop, but it won't be shooting that picture out with the speed of it predecessor.It's the size of the Spectra, so it not going to be sliding into a back pocket or tiny handbag.It does have a learning curve as I kept finding features but then not being able to locate them again later.All in all a well made product that brings back a bit of the Polaroid fun days.  While I agree it is sitting at a bit of a high price point, I don't think you'll be disappointed.And if you are Amazon does returns.P. S. I have read a number of reviews on various other sites with people saying that Polaroid isn't useful any longer as they can capture images with their phones and load directly to Facebook to share.  To those people I can only say you are absolutely correct.  You can do all of those things and this camera is definitely not for you.  Please move on.  You don't get it and quite frankly those who do don't feel like explaining it to you.UPDATE:  THERE IS A CARD IN THE BATTERY SLOT THAT SAYS REMOVE BEFORE INSERTING BATTERY.  IT IS A BIT HIDDEN SO LOOK FOR IT.

Reviews.Title: i love my new polaroid it brings back the old good days
Reviews.Author: mimi "love to party"
Reviews.Content: If you will Hand a ZINK printer to one of your parents and they¡¯ll probably look at you dumbfounded.  Hand a Polaroid camera to them, though, and they¡¯ll know instantly what to do with it.  Polaroid, a company that killed off one of their core product offerings to make way for the digital revolution, is finally back with a device that mimics the original form factor of the Polaroid camera yet marries the printer tech of today.This Polaroid Z340 that I just got is an Instant Digital Camera works like a standard 14 megapixel digital point and shoot camera, allowing you to view photos instantly on the 2.7-inch screen as well as make small edits.  Photos can be downloaded to a computer from its SD card or you can print them instantly using the device¡¯s built-in printer.  The size of the prints, 3¡Á4¡å, are the same exact size as the first Polaroid camera, which means those with a taste for nostalgia, or perhaps even an aversion to new tech, will instantly understand the offering of this digital camera. The printer, unlike Polaroid¡¯s original camera, uses a tech called ZINK ¨C it stands for Zero Ink.  In other words, no ink is used to process the image, and instead depends on an advanced composite material with cyan, yellow, and magenta dye crystals embedded inside.  Heat those crystals and an image appears that will last for time to come thanks to a smudge proof tech and a water resistant coating.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Phil
Reviews.Content: For those of you who are old fashioned and still like the old style Polaroid camera will have a blast with this. Those of you who are more modern will also like this camera because it also has the features of a digital camera. You can snap photos and put in instant film and duplicate your memories as many times as you want.

Reviews.Title: Paper Jam - no description about jams in user manual - inusfficient support page
Reviews.Author: sj@gno.de
Reviews.Content: I got the camera for my wife as a birthday gift. Because some said to ignore the bad reviews I did. After only 3 prints, the paper jamed. There is nothing about paper jams in the user manual!! The polaroid support page has no FAQs or upgrades or anything like this, just a bunch of telefone numbers and email addresses. Half of the email addresses do not work!!!The camera concept is very nice but right now it is out of service for us, and support is not reachable. I will either return it or get it fixed. But in any case this product is unsatisfactory. Look at the price to you expect this quality and service? I do not, I expect way better.

Reviews.Title: How to fix paper jams
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: I got one of these cameras recently and love it! Although it did get a paper jam- there is a simple way to fix it. If the paper is not sticking out of the front- do not pull with tweezers- call the Polaroid customer service 1-877-456-6055. Tell them your problem and give them your email. They should send you a folder with instructions and a program update. You will want to copy and paste this program onto the SD card that you insert into your camera- I had to go buy one- they cost anywhere from $10-$20 and they will increase the storage capacity of your camera as well as help you out here. Put the SD card back into the camera. Turn the camera off and slide the button to "capture" mode. Then turn on the camera and press "WIDE" repeatedly (The instructions said to press power and wide together-but this did not work for me.) The wide button is the button with 3 trees on it. A menu should pop up and select "computer" and press "ok." Then let it do its thing for about 3 minutes. It should spit out the paper.

Reviews.Title: Terrible terrible terrible
Reviews.Author: C. Leinart
Reviews.Content: I love cameras - i have multiple cameras for multiple uses and this is the absolute worst ever.  The quality of the prints are terrible.  The paper turns sort of a bluish color.  The battery life is terrible and to top it all off, i lost my charger and there is no such thing as a replacement charger in Polaroid-land.  Really...you CANNOT buy a replacement charger.  So if you have one of these, hang on to the charger and be prepared to only use for fun party pics - it's novel but not worth the $$.

Reviews.Title: Awesome product !
Reviews.Author: wbitt15774
Reviews.Content: Awesome product! Polaroid quality with modern technology. Instant photos with the ability to view and edit before printing. Photo quality is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Polaroid Charm Lives On - But Do Your Research!
Reviews.Author: Zoe
Reviews.Content: After a false start with a Z340 that didn't work, I finally got my hands on a working model. The camera has some really neat modes & features, and the ability to spit out instant prints (which is why I bought it). That being said, the instant prints are only OK in quality. Do your research before you drop the $2.5 hundo on this one, because if you don't know the quality of the prints you're in for you're bound to be dissapointed. That being said, you can always hook the camera up and print out better quality photos via an ink or laserjet. NOTE: I find you get better prints when you dont use the flash.However, if you're a fan of the old polaroid cameras, and love vintage-looking photos you'll have a lot of fun with this camera. I really enjoy that I get to choose the photo that I print! With the old polaroid cameras you wind up with a lot of expensive junk prints. Not so with the Z340. The ability to add borders to your prints adds a sprinkle of photobooth-like charm. This camera is very well thought out for the amateur photographer with lots of fun modes / features / ease of use. If you're out to take fun silly photos, or capture a nice moment & you aren't a super anal photo-snob, you'll have a blast.Dog Owners & Moms will LOVE "Kid Mode". It's been an awesome feature that I pretty much use all the time in my dog boutique. I use the camera for the souviner photo portion of my charity events. I advertise the prints as "vintage" and the customer gets to pick their photo. Everyone has a good time & Loves it!I also enjoy that the battery is charged while it's in the camera (ac adapter plugs into side of camera). For some reason I hate seperate battery chargers. I ALWAYS Loose them.The only other gripe I have is that there is no view finder. You're completely dependant on the LCD screen. It's not so bad once you get used to it, but it does take a second. And this is a large camera. I loved using the larger polaroids of yore, so I'm ok with a larger camera.Anywho, you can get all this info by just reading other reviews available on the interwebs, so don't be lazy & Do your research!Polaroid, if you're listening, a few requests for the next version:1. a viewfinder.2. better quality prints (Bigger prints? 3x4 is still a bit small)3. Better Materials. Heavier plastic, or even metal would be rad. The camera has kind of a cheap feel in some respects, but nothing that will hinder the fun.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Photography Student
Reviews.Content: Although the concept of this camera is excellent, it is not worth the $250 I paid for it. The printing quality of the camera is overall disappointing. The photos look great on the LCD, but once printed they are low quality, miscolored, and noisy. If you are going to sell a product for this much money and praise the quality of Zink printing paper and the cameras ability to do so - then I expect it to make at least half-decent prints. I wouldnt have a problem with the camera otherwise. Maybe if Polaroid made more original Polaroid paper for the cameras that are now cherished, there wouldnt be a need for this instant digital Polaroid with results that are nothing like the original. And yes, there is film for sale on the website, but $23 for 8 photos? Are you kidding me? I am a student trying to get a project done, not go broke.

Reviews.Title: Good service on the return
Reviews.Author: Louisa R. Spina
Reviews.Content: This product was a huge dissapointment. There is no replacement for the original polaroid camera.  This camera is merely a digital camera with a built in printer.  Hard to hold, buttons are small, and just generally an inconvenient way to catch the moment.  Use your cell phone for better results, lol.I can say that the return process was exemplary and I had the chance to try out the camera for the cost of return shipping.

Reviews.Title: Honestly fair and appreciative
Reviews.Author: taino
Reviews.Content: I got this about a week ago and the pictures arent all hd or anything but remember its only a 14 mp camera. The pictures are fair quality and all my friends are really amazed by it when I pull it out they even ask me to print them out a copy when they see the picture come out. I'm just happy I can have a photo album and not have all my pictures on a memory card that can be lost or have on instgram when I delete my account all my pictures will be gone forever. People are just picky. And as for battery life you can just take as many pictures as you can and wait till you get home to print them out instead of printing them out on the spot and have it die on you

Reviews.Title: I love Polaroid but these instant-photos are pretty bad...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Aarzak"
Reviews.Content: Pictures look amazing on the LCD screen, even more amazing when you crop, and add borders. But when i printed my very first picture, camera got jammed.After trying fixing that pain in the neck problem, the pictures look very bad. White colors look literally pink.It's nothing close as old-school polaroid instant pictures. I got exited for nothing.Bought it for xmas and sent back today 12/28/12, thank God for amazon's great customer service, returning the camera was and always is pretty easy.

Reviews.Title: Iffy reliability and glitchy
Reviews.Author: The Hoff
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera to use for a photo guest book at our wedding. When it works, it works okay. But I repeatedly had to do tech support, during my own wedding reception, to fix random problems that shouldn't occur. Such as: the camera repeatedly printing the same photo over and over again, or in some cases simply refusing to print certain photos (it would act like it was going to print, but never pull the paper, and never even gave an error message).The camera is a really neat idea and the printing technology is actually quite nice. But they really needed to QA this thing a bit longer before they put it out there.

Reviews.Title: Cool camera!
Reviews.Author: malkovich
Reviews.Content: While I use my Instax 210 both for business and at home, the Z340 is my every-day snap-shot camera. I bought it primarily because I wanted to have Polaroid-style pictures at a fraction of the Impossible film's cost. The Instax 210 is an awesome camera and I highly recommend it - however, it produces modern-looking, clean pictures (which is great for many applications, of course :-) but I also wanted to have that old-style instant-film look with all it's imperfections. The Z340 delivers exactly that. The pictures aren't as clean as modern prints - the photos sometimes have a slightly reddish tint (as a matter of fact, they look almost identical to what Polaroids used to look like when the original film was still made), they sometimes have minor imperfections. They look awesome to me because they're exactly what I want.Of course, you can also use the Z340 to take pictures to an SD card and have them printed at a photo lab or on your own printer. The 14 megapixel sensor is actually surprisingly good, even in low light. It runs circles around most modern point-and-shoots, that's for sure. The high resolution sensor also allows for the digital zoom to work well without having to worry about picture size afterwards.The handling of the camera is very good. The camera's screen flips up and you hold the cam like you would hold any Polaroid camera. They could have included an optical viewfinder - although one has to say that on most instant cameras you never got a through-the-lens view finder, meaning that the optical one they had actually made it difficult to frame the pictures properly. In that respect, I prefer the screen.All in all, I'm giving this one 5 points. If you're looking for clinically perfect prints, look elsewhere. If you want those cosy family pictures you used to love in the 70s, 80s and 90s, you can't go wrong whit this camera.

Reviews.Title: This is my favorite camera.
Reviews.Author: Lance Larson
Reviews.Content: I own plenty of cameras.  Everything from my first professional minolta srt 202 film camera to my Nikon 3200 DSLR.  But, with this camera, the Z340 has the capability to be instant Polaroid with the built in component of digital.  The Zink Media 3 by 4 Inch paper is great and the quality is good.  This is a must have for any Polaroid lover.

Reviews.Title: Sent me a used camera
Reviews.Author: CL R.
Reviews.Content: I paid full price for a new camera and got a used one with film and someone else's pictures in it. Needless to say, I am beside myself.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful! Ignore Negative Feedback!!!
Reviews.Author: Meg
Reviews.Content: I spent a week doing research on what type of polaroid camera I should purchase and was afraid because there were many feedbacks complaining about something :( But this is perfect and I am glad I made the choice of picking this one!!! Yes it looks a bit old but for instant pictures you cannot be too greedy. I love it. I am not the picture taking type. I never have time to go to the store and print them off. It is nice to capture moments and print them off instantly. Plus they can be saved on your SD card so if you want more you have them backed up. Great product!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Alex Stephenson
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera, but difficult to carry around, should come with some kind of case. But very fun to have, worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Great buy, a little buggy
Reviews.Author: E. Jacobs
Reviews.Content: I have over tens of thousands of polaroids in my life and was sad to see them go. This is the perfect progression of polaroid. You can change the colour of the picture and choose what oyu want to print. The only issues I have is that you cannot scale the photo if you want to use the iconic border. Also, sometimes the camera will print a blank page and each time it does that, it drains the battery.

Reviews.Title: Great Instant Prints for All Ages
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I was originally worried about the pricing of this camera and it's associated Zink Paper, but since using it I am so glad I made the investment!This camera is perfect for anyone who is tired of making trips to the photo center, for photo journaling, for kids and adults, and for sharing with friends. I can snap away tons of photos and print the ones I like back at home or on the run to give to friends. This would be a great camera to give a child on vacation since you can easily make an album out of the prints as you go along. This is perfect for my photo journal.With all the custom borders and settings like black and white and sepia tone I have no need for photoshop. You can crop the photos in camera and see the finished result before printing.The camera is easy to transport, smaller slightly than the old Polaroid 600 cameras, and fits well in the hand. It does great in a variety of lighting conditions.If you're on the fence about buying this camera, go for it! You won't regret your decision.

Reviews.Title: Photos fair quality
Reviews.Author: Laura M. Jelinek
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Polaroid Z340 Zink camera so that as we took photos with my 5 year old, we could print out quickly and share with family and friends. The photos are of fair quality and tend to fade a bit after taking them.  I am disappointed in the quality of the pictures.

Reviews.Title: Good classic but BAD QUALITY PRINTING
Reviews.Author: A. Durongkadej "Matt"
Reviews.Content: First I just wanted to say that this Polaroid z340 gives a look of good classic looking camera body.  a good thing is that this camera can choose which picture to print and pictures can be edited before printing or even ad border.The bad is that this polaroid z340 give a bad quality printing, I tried it for a week and took quite a few pictures, when I print them they are all have lines across the picture, sometime on the side or top.  Pictures are printed differently from the view finder.  On the view finder pictures look very clear and nice in color, but when it turns to print, color is not fully rich and clear.I am returning this Polaroid and will try to order another one in a hope that this current one is defective not by design of Polaroid z340.

Reviews.Title: Talk about all in one!
Reviews.Author: Watch&See
Reviews.Content: This little printing capable camera gives new meaning to the term 'all in one'. You get a 14 megapixel camera, integrated printer to pop off prints right after shooting, all with no computer connection--or ink, necessary. Definitely worth a look. Or another look!

Reviews.Title: A Must Have Camera for Instant Pictures
Reviews.Author: Stephanie
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised when I found this camera.  I do alot of insurance work so to be able to get the pictures instantly is huge for me.  This camera is cost efficient and also easy to use.  I used to carry a photo printer around with me to print pictures but this is so much simpler - point, shoot, print and zip...there's your picture.

Reviews.Title: Still needs work
Reviews.Author: Stephen C. Strattman
Reviews.Content: Got this camera for a Christmas present.  Unfortunately, it still needs work.  On the second picture to print, there was  paper jam and this shut down the camera.  It would not take any further pictures.  I could not remove the paper  jam.  Ruined Christmas for my 3 year old grand daughter.  Was promptly refunded by seller.  Great customer service.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product!
Reviews.Author: Gaston Black
Reviews.Content: This is such a fun product. Not only do you get fast, high quality images, but it does not require any ink! It is like an improved version of the old Polaroid cameras. You can print the date on the picture if you like, which is a great feature for people who like to keep their images organized. You can even add cool borders and things to customize your pictures. These are great for kids birthday parties and other family gatherings.Its hassle free, ink free photo printing. How can you beat that?

Reviews.Title: Photo Booth Fun
Reviews.Author: Ali
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a fun photo booth idea for my kiddos birthday parties.  It is SO cool!  My daughters bestie was in town visiting this weekend and I set up a photo booth for them to have fun while all the kids were in and out of the house - I'm out of paper!!My only criticism is the battery life is short, but it's no biggie, we just kept it plugged in since the camera was on a tripod anyway.I love it!

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Christopher J. Hill
Reviews.Content: I love cameras and this one is just so cool! I was hesitant about ZINK...but if you fiddle with the settings you can get some cool prints. Its not for someone whos not camera savvy. If you just point and shoot using AUTO ..it wont deliver, some of the programmable settings/pre-sets are pretty cool. Id give this camera a chance if you like instant cameras.

Reviews.Title: Worked great for 1 pack of Zink paper
Reviews.Author: S. I. Shaw
Reviews.Content: Then it started showing a line on the right hand side of the printed picture.  Then it stopped printing (although it would sound as if it was printing).  Currently, the screen reads "fatal error."

Reviews.Title: Camera's fine; battery insertion terrible.
Reviews.Author: Becky O. Irico
Reviews.Content: I gave this as a gift, and found out later all the problems involved with inserting the battery.  Finally, the recipient found a review here describing the ridiculous technique necessary for insertion.  A liner, scarcely visible, must be removed.  In this case the process was achieved with tweezers.  The problem could quite simply be averted with instructions for battery insertion.  I dislike giving a gift that is difficult to set up or use, thus my 3 star rating.  It is also the only review I've ever written, and I've done so only because I felt so strongly about this issue.

Reviews.Title: poor quality in pictures...
Reviews.Author: Deborah Cole
Reviews.Content: This camera should ahve been priced at just $10.00 because of the poor quality in the pictures and only one camera at that.  It could not be exchanged for another one.  Bummer.  The delivery by On Trac was even worst.  they just dumped it on my poorch in plain view of the rugh neighborhood and claimed I signed for it when I didn't.

Reviews.Title: Blue Tinge
Reviews.Author: Sofia
Reviews.Content: At first the picture printed decent. But then the next time I used it, the outer white part of the polaroid border come out blue. . Is this normal?

Reviews.Title: Battery
Reviews.Author: j
Reviews.Content: The battery does not keep the charge for less than two hours. I do not know if it was bad from the factory, but not served

Reviews.Title: grand daughter loved it
Reviews.Author: griggie
Reviews.Content: It was a gift for college student is very photographic astute.  She has a good digital SLR but loves this. It has lots of cool features.

Reviews.Title: Not Impressed.
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed by it's look & feel. judging by the way the screen "pops up" for you to view it I got the impression it was cheaply made. It would take clear video but pictures had horizontal lines through them, even when transferred to my PC to view them. I didn't use the print feature since I could not take a clear picture.My guess is that I just got a bad one but i returned it rather than exchanging it.

Reviews.Title: Cool old school feel
Reviews.Author: andrew
Reviews.Content: Haven't actually obtained my camera from the seller but my brother has one and it is awesome works similar to the old school Polaroid

Reviews.Title: Great camera! missing the old style real frame.
Reviews.Author: Andres Lara
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my wedding day, I want to have the pictures right away, and loved the plus of having them in digital format too.  It prints great, but the polaroid frame doesn't look as good as I expected.

Reviews.Title: Fun but....
Reviews.Author: Britt
Reviews.Content: I really like it but I wish their was a bigger selection of borders to choose from. I feel like some of the ones on there are really cheesy. All in all though its what I imagined it to be like.

Reviews.Title: Z340 Fun!
Reviews.Author: Auburn Girl
Reviews.Content: I am so excited to have this camera!I love the whole idea of the instant pictures and modern technology combined!! Brings back a lot of great memories!I just got the camera and left for vacation but I have a problem. After a few pictures my screen went white? There are no messages or helpful info to guide me thru the problem. I'm not sure if I did something wrong or if the camera is at fault. The phone service is Monday-Friday and not available now. I sent an email but too soon to get a response. Has anyone had this problem? Does anyone have a thought?I'f it turns out to be the camera I will definitely return for another! I really want it to work because it is such a neat product!!Please help if you can! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Very good quality for this price.
Reviews.Author: Tommy
Reviews.Content: The camera has very good quality photos that come out within no time at all. I hate crappy cameras that take a long time to produce a picture but this one didn't do that. It also is very light as well. Easy to carry.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Hamilton Robertson
Reviews.Content: This has got to be one of the greatest inventions ever created. Quality is picture perfect, and best of all it has a built in printer, which takes away many troubles. Everyone should own at least one of these, they're easy to use and will save you alot of time.

Reviews.Title: Awesome print
Reviews.Author: drumbummer
Reviews.Content: I really love this, brings me back to the days when i had a big clunky Polaroid.  great camera, with a great picture, and great print job.  I absolutely recommend this to anyone who is into polaroid's.

Reviews.Title: works great!
Reviews.Author: j.disafache
Reviews.Content: I have to say this machine works beautifully! no problems whatsoever. I had trouble using my regular hp printer for photos over the glossy paper. But this worked so much better and was easy to utilize. I definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: a very amazing and economical camera
Reviews.Author: Non
Reviews.Content: This is a camera and printer all in one. Because its a 14Mp camera definitely the resolution is high and pictures are very sharp and vibrant.You can even edit the pictures immediately without requiring any external device like photoshop etc. The viewer is quite big which gives you a magnified view of the shot. They have an exclusive ZINK ( zero ink technology )that make everything inkless, thus avoiding expensive toners or ribbons when printing. Also since it is using rechargeable batteries it will definitely hold a longer charge and wont have any problem bringing spare batteries along. Highly recommend the product

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera!
Reviews.Author: Vivica
Reviews.Content: This camera is very cool and I love to use it. The quality of the camera itself is great, and I couldn't ask for better quality pictures. I highly recommend this to both amateur and professional photographers, you will not regret buying it!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful cross between the old and the new
Reviews.Author: vvalkerguy2
Reviews.Content: Interesting product from long time camera company Polaroid! This is wonderful because its your good ol' fashioned Polaroid crossed with the more modern digital camera. You can click those photos and put in instant film and copy your pics again and again. I recommend this product to anyone who has ever owned a Polaroid but is looking to become more current!

Reviews.Title: My favorite Camera!
Reviews.Author: Angel
Reviews.Content: For the holidays I received the Polaroid Z340 Instant Digital Camera with zink printing technology and I have to say it was my favorite gift! I took a variety of pictures with friends and family and they all came out great. The camera was easy to travel around with the color is great! The pictures look like they were taken by a professional photographer. I recommend this camera to everyone!

Reviews.Title: 14Mp digital camera Poloraid
Reviews.Author: lauralove
Reviews.Content: My Poloraid 14Mp digital camera  is just amazing.  I got it for Christmas and I love it.  It prints in custom boarders.  You can view and crop.  Also the pics are water & smudge resistant.Its just what I wanted and I can take it with me just about anywehre.

Reviews.Title: A Must have
Reviews.Author: vw bus
Reviews.Content: I used polariod cameras for years and loved them, it was a sad day when film became hard to impossible to get. I was so glad they started producing these type cameras again. I have taken loads of pics with my new one and love it. Easy to use, fun to share with and takes awesome pics.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: smileealb
Reviews.Content: I was so excited when I received this camera as my early Christmas present.  Our little girl came two weeks before Christmas and this has been the best camera I could have gotten.  I love the instant high quality pictures that I get everytime I take a picture.  This made sending out Christmas pictures in our Christmas cards extremely easy.  I highly recommend this camera to any one that is looking for an easy way to take and receive awesome pictures.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: anheddie
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice camera .This automatically save photos to itself or SD card for downloadingand Prints in under a minute.I recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working while on vacation
Reviews.Author: Traveller
Reviews.Content: Only had this camera a couple of weeks.  Took it along on vacation, and it started taking all white pictures, and then  pictures with lines on them.  Now I have no pics of the last week of my trip!

Reviews.Title: Good, download online manual!
Reviews.Author: KarenRS "karenjrs"
Reviews.Content: I'm having great fun with this. I had missed polaroids. So far can't get the  print later to work but just downloaded the full manual, so have hope. Print when taken,  like a regular polaroid,  is working fine.  Slow but no slower than old polaroids,  also same cost about per photo, so no complaints. Good zoom, accurate frame, I like it!

Reviews.Title: Old Polaroid with digital technology
Reviews.Author: Malky
Reviews.Content: Clear picture plus the benefit of the digital life extra plus for the custom border feature kinda like the old Polaroid just with updated technology

Reviews.Title: Polaroid is back with a BANG on your Wallet
Reviews.Author: Apple Jacki "Jack"
Reviews.Content: Polaroid is a bang on your wallet! The new Polaroid Z340 Instant Camera is now available and it's big, cute, packed with features, and it's expensive.Revision: After posting my review and thoughts on this camera, I received numerous emails and comments from my readers.  They wanted more precise and point to point feedback. The Polaroid does not cost $99 to $149.  It cost $299.  Sorry for the confusion.What I like about Polaroid Z340 is the fact it will take pictures in low light and it won't hunt for the subject or the shutter button won't hesitate to click.  I like the style, design, and it's pretty similar (build) like the old polaroids.  After watching the videos on this product, I had to get it. So, please check out youtube for videos before getting it.HOWEVER, this Polaroid is expensive and will bang your wallet for $300 bucks.  It's totally overpriced and I will only pay $ 99 to $ 149 for this camera.The features I don't like about this camera is the handle strap on the right side of the camera, the high glare on the screen, and the print out of the images.If you use the hand strap, you have to avoid hitting the shutter buttons or other switches. There isn't any place to rest your hands but against the buttons which will change the camera settings. The LCD screen adjustment is normal, bright, or auto.  It's too bright for a 2.7" screen.  The color bleeds.  The battery life is REALLY, REALLY, and I mean REALLY bad. You can only take 75 pictures or print 25 photos before the battery goes dead. UCK! If you had a point and shoot or a smart-phone, you can take pictures all night, never miss a shot, hide it in your pocket, make a phone call, text a friend or two, and you won't have to recharge until the event is over.If you use the Polaroid Z340 at events or at parties, you will need to buy a backup rechargeable batteries ($25 ea). If you are printing all night, you would need at least 2 packs of the Zink "3x4" paper which is also expensive ($ 20 for 30 sheets).As much as I wanted to like this cute Polaroid Z340 camera, I can't.  The price is very hard to swallow, the photo sheets are very expensive,  and the print out is too flat, no detail, and has a hue (orange/yellow) tint.  These days you can capture great images with a smartphone or a point and shoot camera and print it on a wirelessly bluetooth printer.

Reviews.Title: Not happy
Reviews.Author: caitlyne
Reviews.Content: It doesn't print the photos like old school Polaroids. It prints them as regular pictures. I'm dissatisfied and a tad upset.

Reviews.Title: Not the product you wants
Reviews.Author: chunyanwang
Reviews.Content: First I bought this camera, on the first time I used it was paper jam. Then I got the replacement. In the Seneca brand new one I opened which the camera screen was damage and it could not see clear. Immoderately got the refund. This camera let me feel this out of date quality of this product. Terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: missing line cable
Reviews.Author: Allwyn
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift to my wife and its missing a line cable. But she like the camera very much

Reviews.Title: You get your money's worth!!
Reviews.Author: lilac_landa
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. I'm so glad I decided to investment in a high quality digital camera. I am really enjoying it. Nothing like take pictures with family and friends and cherishing the results immediately!! The camera works well, easy to use, and will probably last a long time.

Reviews.Title: Sweet camera!
Reviews.Author: waynesburg
Reviews.Content: Its a modern day Polaroid need I say more! With the display you know what your getting right away! What a great camera I could not be more happy with it!

Reviews.Title: blast from the past
Reviews.Author: Evelyn Snavely
Reviews.Content: The last time I have seen a camera that printed the pictures out was when my brother was born 13 years ago. Its nice to see things like this coming back. This is a great twist on an old product. It really has quality results and are perfect for scrapbooking.

Reviews.Title: Definitely Not The "Old Polaroid"
Reviews.Author: connieb9132005
Reviews.Content: The Polaroid Z340 Instant Digital Camera was a GREAT purchase and a pleasant surprise.  I saw it first advertised not long before Christmas and told my teenage daughter about it.  She promptly turned her nose up when she heard "Polaroid" and "Instant" used in the same sentence, remembering my old instant Polaroid camera that I STILL have and the STILL works many years later,  I bought it for her anyway knowing that she would love it if she would just take a minute to look at the specs.  Digital, rechargeable, snap, print, share - no computer connections.  I knew she would love it, which she did.  But I couldn't resist at first presenting it as my own Christmas present that I purchased for myself to try out.  She was green with envy.  Now I'm green with envy after having relinquished it to her for Christmas.  I need one for myself.  Would definitely recommend it as a sound purchase for anyone.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: patricia trujillo
Reviews.Content: Excellent product, I served a lot for what you buy.Buy it again. I highly recommend it.We were very happy with the product.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Amanda Varney
Reviews.Content: Does not print 'Polaroid' pics, just digital pics with Polaroid style borders. Also, you can only take 25 pictures on one battery charge so it can't really be used for any sort of event.

Reviews.Title: easy to locate
Reviews.Author: Carol Henderson
Reviews.Content: the package was well packaged especially since it is such a delicate item. received fairly quickly. I have no complaints

Reviews.Title: A lot of fun!
Reviews.Author: alexkoch
Reviews.Content: This is a very interesting camera, makes a lot of fun especially on the parties. The picture quality is excellent!

Reviews.Title: Battery cannot be inserted! defective product with NO support!
Reviews.Author: Sergio Lemus "Sergio Lemus"
Reviews.Content: a couple of days ago I received the camera, it looked great so I started unpacking all the items. When I tried to insert the battery into the battery compartment, it wouldn't go all the way to the end, I looked inside and found a white RFID tag placed right on top of the pins that should make contact with the battery... I will try removing that unreasonable piece of plastic and then try again. I have no idea how in this world someone would do that. I'm totally impressed. If removing that piece doesn't work, I'll have to throw the camera away.I will post a picture so you see what im talking about.

Reviews.Title: bad
Reviews.Author: disappointed
Reviews.Content: Did not work right of the box. Polaroid wanted me to send it back for repairs. I contacted and sent it back and received a refund, I would not recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: too complicated
Reviews.Author: Maria A.
Reviews.Content: no instructions how to  charge!?complicated to use no practical dont buy it, is not worth it waist money ok? not worth it

Reviews.Title: I cannot even install the battery!!!!
Reviews.Author: hzl
Reviews.Content: I cannot even insert the battery into the compartment! Yep I did remove the tiny white tag already, the compartment door just won't close!

Reviews.Title: Polaroid 340
Reviews.Author: DAVID'S KINLE
Reviews.Content: We purchased the Polaroid Z340 through Amazon.  The battery that came with the camera does not fit in the camera.  There is no way of contacting the manufacturer, nor Amazon for assistance, other than through the internet.  So, the product is unsatisfactory, and the customer support of Amazon is lousy.  So, Amazon, what are you going to do about it?
